item.title: James add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: James add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: James add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: James add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: James add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: James add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: James add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: James add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: James add a quote by Thomas Szasz
item.description: "Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse." -- Thomas Szasz

item.title: James add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: James add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: James add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: James add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: James add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: James add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: James add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: James add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: James add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: James add a quote by David Byrne
item.description: "Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence." -- David Byrne

item.title: James add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: James add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: James add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: James add a quote by Anthony G. Oettinger
item.description: "Time flies like an arrow; fruit flies like a banana." -- Anthony G. Oettinger

item.title: James add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: James add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: James add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: James add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: James add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: James add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: James add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain
